topics.body:
I was reading huffingtonpost, yeah I know biased news, and they made a very fucking good point about the tech boom; the tech boom is very bad in the long run because all the money in technology is being placed into the wrong sectors.

Hold on a second before someone goes, "uc9 being 'pcmaster race' again"; the problems right now with the tech boom are that everyone's investing into cellphones, apps, consoles, cyber security and shit.

Reasons why this is bad:
1)the reason why cyber security has so much money going towards it is that windows and mac operating systems are intentionally being made with poor security in the name of security; backdoors that fucking everyone knows about.  The reason why this is bad is that SteamOS is coming out soon and while SteamOS obviously won't take over the market it'll force the other other operating systems whenever a new one comes out to have to be stable thus fucking up all that money going towards cyber security.

Basically windows' security is intentionally crappy; once steamos comes out they'll be forced to make not crap operating systems or lose massive numbers of users.
2)Consoles in the long run are a bad idea, inb4 "nuh-uh uc9 is a doody head", because by 2020 a $1000 desktop computer will be able to run as many computations as a human brain.  To put it simply ten years from now you'll be able to run Crysis 3 on your watch.  Also we're so close to realistic graphics in games that you can't make games look any better now without running into the uncanny valley.

The next big thing gaming wise is VR, *NOT* graphics so ten years from now if everything including your watch can play realistic looking games at 100fps then what is the point in a dedicated machine to play video games?  Simply put if even a calculator can play crysis then why do you need a console?
3)There is a market for apps, but the reason why the market is so shit right now for them is too many cooks in the kitchen; there's a fucking overload of oversaturation of money and no where near enough money.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: Had to get a cavity filled today. My dentist has tiny TVs attached to all of the chairs so you can kind of sort of watch your favorite Doctor Phil rerun over the sound of dental instruments humming in your mouth. And as he was filling mine in, I was forced to watch the very beginning of Shrek. I had to watch him cleaning his ass as my mouth was wide open. What a way to start the day.
